[[trapno-encoding]]
==== TRAPNO encoding (v0.3 bring-up)

* TRAPNO is shared for faults, traps, and interrupts.
* E=1 indicates asynchronous interrupt; E=0 indicates synchronous fault/trap.
* ARGV=1 indicates TRAPARG0 is valid.

Bit layout:

[source]
----
63        62        47        24        5      0
+----------+----------+----------------+--------+
|    E     |   ARGV   |     CAUSE      | TRAPNUM|
+----------+----------+----------------+--------+
----

[%header,cols="1,1,3"]
|===
|Field |Bits |Description

|`E` |`[63]` |Asynchronous interrupt indicator (1=async interrupt, 0=sync fault/trap).
|`ARGV` |`[62]` |TRAPARG0 valid (1=valid).
|`CAUSE` |`[47:24]` |Sub-cause encoding (profile-defined per TRAPNUM).
|`TRAPNUM` |`[5:0]` |Trap major class (6-bit).
|===

Bring-up trap classes:

[%header,cols="1,1,1,4"]
|===
|TRAPNUM |Dec |Name |Description

|`0b000000` |0 |`EXEC_STATE_CHECK` |Target Exec State Check (e.g. illegal ACRE target).
|`0b000100` |4 |`ILLEGAL_INST` |Illegal instruction / illegal SSR / illegal encoding.
|`0b000101` |5 |`BLOCK_TRAP` |Block-level trap (format/legality violations).
|`0b000110` |6 |`SCALL` |System call (ACRC).
|`0b100000` |32 |`INST_PC_FAULT` |Instruction PC fault (alignment/canonicality).
|`0b100001` |33 |`INST_PAGE_FAULT` |Instruction page fault (IFSC in CAUSE).
|`0b100010` |34 |`DATA_ALIGN_FAULT` |Data alignment fault.
|`0b100011` |35 |`DATA_PAGE_FAULT` |Data page fault (DFSC/LaneNum/WnR in CAUSE).
|`0b101100` |44 |`INTERRUPT` |Interrupt class (E=1, TRAPARG0=irq_id).
|`0b110001` |49 |`HW_BREAKPOINT` |Hardware breakpoint trap.
|`0b110010` |50 |`SW_BREAKPOINT` |Software breakpoint trap (EBREAK).
|`0b110011` |51 |`HW_WATCHPOINT` |Hardware watchpoint trap.
|===
